DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy BI 1744 CL Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease I
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : 1 . All patient must diagnosis chronic obstructive pulmonary disease must meet follow spirometric criterion : postbronchodilator FEV1 < 80 % predict normal ( ECSC ) postbronchodilator FEV1/FVC < 70 % Visit 1 2 . Male female patient , 40 year age old 3 . Patients must current exsmokers smoke history 10 pack year : Exclusion criterion : 1 . Patients clinically relevant abnormal baseline haematology , blood chemistry , urinalysis ; patient SGOT > x2 ULN , SGPT > x2 ULN , bilirubin > x2 ULN creatinine > x2 ULN 2 . Patients history asthma and/or total blood eosinophil count great 600/mm3 3 . Patients thyrotoxicosis , paroxysmal tachycardia ( > 100 beat per minute ) 4 . Patients history myocardial infarction within 1 year screen visit , unstable lifethreatening cardiac arrhythmia , hospitalization heart failure within past year , know active tuberculosis , malignancy patient undergone resection , radiation therapy chemotherapy within last five year , lifethreatening pulmonary obstruction , cystic fibrosis , clinically evident bronchiectasis , significant alcohol drug abuse 5 . Patients undergone thoracotomy pulmonary resection 6 . Patients treat oral betaadrenergics oral corticosteroid medication unstable dos ( i.e. , less six week stable dose ) dose excess equivalent 10 mg prednisone per day 20 mg every day . 7 . Patients regularly use daytime oxygen therapy one hour per day . 8 . Patients complete pulmonary rehabilitation program six week prior screen visit ( Visit 1 ) patient currently pulmonary rehabilitation program 9 . Pregnant nursing woman 10 . Women childbearing potential use two effective method birth control ( one barrier one nonbarrier ) .
